messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: As we discussed offline, rename thumbnail-stack to thumbnail-wrapper or something similar. Also, remove top-thumbnail.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Nit: if you decide not to move this function now, put a TODO here so we don't forget to investigate this later.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> As we discussed offline, rename thumbnail-stack to thumbnail-wrapper or
> something similar. Also, remove top-thumbnail.

Done.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:

Done.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: nit: for (var i = 0, length = blanks.length; i < length; ++i)

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Does this code handle the case when data.length == 0?

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Nit: Thumbnail is a <a> element, which is an inline element. According to 3WC we are not supposed to have block elements inside inline elements. For this reason I think it is cleaner to use <span> instead of <div>.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Make 3 a constant so it is easier to tweak the gap value?

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> nit: for (var i = 0, length = blanks.length; i < length; ++i)

Done.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> Does this code handle the case when data.length == 0?

Yes, the else clause will be called.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> You always use (stackSize - 1), so I'd change this line to:
> var blankStackSize = Math.min(data.tabs.length, MAX_STACK_SIZE) - 1;
> 
> And then I'd use blankStackSize elsewhere.

Done.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Why is this necessary?

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Isn't the width 80px?

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: margin: 0 7px;

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: margin: 0 auto;

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> Why is this necessary?

Things break when there's more than one thumbnail-card (due to the margin-bottom on tile-cell).

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/27 22:48:09, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> Isn't the width 80px?

Not sure why but these values render the same image as background-size:100%.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
jeremycho_google

message: Use CSS rather than JS to offset thumbnails in the stack.
